CPEA'S DIRECTORS HAVE EXPERTISE IN MEDICINE, EDUCATION, NOT-FOR-PROFIT MANAGEMENT, LAW, AND FINANCE. SUCH DIRECTORS WERE INDEPENDENT FROM LLC AND ENGAGED THEIR OWN LEGAL, FINANCIAL, AND OTHER ADVISORS IN CONNECTION WITH THE TRANSACTION. CPEA CONDUCTED IN-DEPTH DUE DILIGENCE WITH RESPECT TO THE TRANSACTION AND RECEIVED A FAIRNESS OPINION FROM A WELL-RESPECTED, INDEPENDENT FINANCIAL FIRM WITH EXPERTISE IN ACQUISITIONS AS TO THE TERMS OF THE PURCHASE AGREEMENT AND PRICE. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF CPEA ALSO BECAME THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE ORGANIZATION AND APPROVED THE TRANSACTION IN THAT CAPACITY.THE TRANSACTION WAS STRUCTURED TO PRESERVE THE FINANCIAL AND OPERATIONAL STRENGTHS OF ULTIMATE MEDICAL ACADEMY (THE "ACADEMY") AND TO AVOID ANY ADVERSE EFFECTS ON STUDENT PROGRAMS AND SERVICES, FACULTY OR STAFF. THE ORGANIZATION WAS NOT REQUIRED TO MAKE ANY PAYMENT TO LLC AT THE TIME OF THE TRANSACTION, SO THAT THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL RESOURCES COULD CONTINUE TO BE DEDICATED TO THE OPERATIONS OF THE ACADEMY. THE PURCHASE PRICE WAS PAID ENTIRELY THROUGH ISSUANCE OF A PROMISSORY NOTE, BEARING A REASONABLE, MARKET-BASED INTEREST RATE AND SUBORDINATED TO THE ORGANIZATION'S BANK INDEBTEDNESS. THE ORGANIZATION MAY DEFER ANY SCHEDULED PAYMENTS OF PRINCIPAL AND INTEREST ON THE PROMISSORY NOTE IF THE CASH BALANCE OR WORKING CAPITAL OF THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT MEET CERTAIN DEFINED THRESHOLDS. THESE TERMS WERE INTENDED TO ALLOW THE ORGANIZATION AND THE ACADEMY TO USE THEIR FINANCIAL RESOURCES TO CONTINUE TO OFFER HIGH QUALITY PROGRAMS AND SERVICES FOR THE ACADEMY'S STUDENTS.
